data.title: Cool place. Nice atmosphere.
data.text: Hard to go wrong having coffee here. Great staff, interesting, subtle decor and pleasant atmosphere. Decent coffee too!

data.title: Morning brew
data.text: My hubby and I stumbled upon this place during a stroll in Downtown Bryan. Lovely atmosphere, comfy chairs and good coffee to boot.

data.title: Good coffee, pleasant ambiance.
data.text: Enjoyable and quaint coffee house in downtown Bryan, close to the LaSalle Hotel.  Danish and muffins superb

data.title: AMAZING coffee!
data.text: I don't think I've ever been to a coffee house that's taken such time to make drinks.  The time that they put in is definitely reflected in the deliciousness of their drinks!!

data.title: The best and most "real" coffee house in BCS
data.text:
t took many years, but BCS now has the closest thing to a real coffee house it has ever had. Harvest is not in a strip mall. Harvest does not have a sterile interior. Harvest is not filled solely with IT geeks clacking away on laptops. Harvest is also not filled with "Jesus freaks" trying to "witness" to you while you are trying to be left in peace. And Harvest does not have crappy coffee. And I pretty much just described almost every other coffee house in BCS, in reverse.

Harvest is in an old building with a beautiful war, brick interior. Indie music played at just the right volume. A vague counter-culture feel here, but this is BCS so you take what you can get.

The coffee is great, from various Texas roasters and you can get drip, chemex, cold brew, whatever floats your boat. Nice tea selection too. 

Great place to study, think, and people watch. Staff are great too, friendly ad not fawning. Harvest is a gem in downtown Bryan.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Outstanding - worth the $s & trip. Similar to Catalina in Houston- delicious coffee and great pastries. Awesome serious and atmosphere.

data.title: Nice spot; high prices
data.text:
Saw this little spot on my way to dinner.   Decided to try it for morning coffee.   I like the rough interior but almost a bit too basic with cracks in ruling and wires to plugs.   

Coffee comes in one size and I was expecting a great cup.   Note to barista: if you put the sugar or other granular items in, you probably should stir it hip to dissolve it.   I didn't ask or watch. But all the sugar was at the bottom.   

The size of the cup (smaller than a grande from that other place) is NOT worth $4.25.   

I tried it and won't be back.  As I sit with my latte from that other place. 

Sorry

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Great coffee!  It's an adorable spot in Downtown Bryan. Skip the trip to Starbucks and go here instead!

data.title: Great cafe, great atmosphere
data.text:
This little gem is tucked in a nice corner in historic downtown Bryan. I went here on Halloween night after dinner with two friends of mine to avoid the crowd in College Station, and it was surprisingly calm and quiet here. I like the red-brick, run-down look inside the cafe - it matches well with the rustic, nostalgic Bryan. I ordered a caramel latte, and it was actually delicious. Recommend the Harvest latte as well.

I would definitely come here again!
